result.execSummary:
Jacob Taylor Thompson was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Jacob Taylor Thompson was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob Taylor Thompson

defendant.name: Thompson, Jacob Taylor
defendant.address: 224 S. Second St., Taylor County Jail, Medford, WI 54451

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Defendant With Court's Response
*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.

Defendant Jacob Taylor Thompson in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nocco indicated that Mr. Thompson is waiving the extradition hearing.  Defendant indicated to the court that he is waiving the extradition hearing.  Court questions defendant.  Court finds defendant is freely and voluntarily waiving extradition hearing. Waiver of extradition/approval by court signed by defendant and the court.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting a $5,000.00 cash bond.  No objection by Attorney Nocco.  Court orders a $5,000.00 cash bond.  When defendant is picked up by Georgia; he is then released from his cash bond.  - rt
